# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) + sum(length(c) for c in lines) > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        push!(lines, word)
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello there, how are you today? I hope everything is going well. This text should be wrapped at 10 characters per line."
print(wrap_string(text))
```

This function will output the text with each line limited to `text_width` characters, adding a newline character as necessary to ensure that no line exceeds this limit.
